item.title: Markets got what they wanted from Powell with a Fed rate cut and they’re still not happy
item.description: Jerome Powell delivered a 25bps rate cut, but Wall Street’s muted reaction reflects concern it was a risk move on jobs, not confidence.

item.title: DBS CEO dinner auction in Singapore fetches $15,000 bid
item.description: The winning bid—more than double the pre-sale estimate—underscores how experiences are increasingly prized in Singapore’s luxury market.

item.title: How Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach is pushing employees to get over their fear of AI
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Jensen & Co. caught in U.S.-China trade war crossfire—again
item.description: Jensen Huang has 4 trillion reasons to smile. But geopolitical instability is making it tougher by the day.

item.title: For one man, the war against Cracker Barrel never really ended
item.description: Sardar Biglari’s 14-year beef with Cracker Barrel has earned him $1 billion—yet the company continues to resist him
